action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this grid and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your grid first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the grids to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short grid description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else. This is your grid:
▢ ▢ X ▢ ▢
▢ ▢ X ▢ ▢
▢ ▢ X ▢ ▢
▢ X ▢ X ▢
X ▢ ▢ ▢ X
DESCRIPTION: 5x5 grid with Xs forming a cross shape, one X in the middle of each side, and one X in the center.

This is my DESCRIPTION: 5x5 grid with Xs forming a cross shape, one X in the middle of each side, and one X in the center.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any additional Xs outside the main cross shape in your grid?

This is my DESCRIPTION: 5x5 grid with Xs forming a cross shape, one X in the middle of each side, and one X in the center.
QUESTION: Are there any additional Xs outside the main cross shape in your grid? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is the center of the grid also marked with an X?

ANSWER: No.
QUESTION: Is the center of the grid also marked with an X? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Does your grid have any Xs that are not aligned with the center or the midpoints of the sides?

ANSWER: Yes.
QUESTION: Does your grid have any Xs that are not aligned with the center or the midpoints of the sides? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are all the Xs in your grid part of the cross formation, with no extra Xs anywhere else?

ANSWER: No.
QUESTION: Are all the Xs in your grid part of the cross formation, with no extra Xs anywhere else? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is the spacing between the Xs in your grid uniform, with equal distances between each X along the rows and columns?

ANSWER: Yes.
QUESTION: Is the spacing between the Xs in your grid uniform, with equal distances between each X along the rows and columns? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Does your grid have any empty spaces that are not surrounded by Xs on all four sides?

ANSWER: Yes.
QUESTION: Does your grid have any empty spaces that are not surrounded by Xs on all four sides? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.

Now come to a decision. What do you think: are your grid and the other grid described the same?  Write "DECISION: same grid" if you think they are the same grid or "DECISION: different grids" if you think they are different grids. Do not add anything else.
